required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Randomized Trial of Induction Methods in Premature Rupture of Membranes
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Trial of Foley Bulb and PGE2 for Labor Induction in Premature Rupture of Membranes

lead_sponsor.agency: Zeynep Kamil Maternity and Pediatric Research and Training Hospital

clinical_study.source: Zeynep Kamil Maternity and Pediatric Research and Training Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the addition of transcervical Foley catheter balloon and vaginal prostaglandin E2 induction in premature rupture of membranes. Half of participants will be used combine transcervical Foley catheter balloon and vaginal prostaglandin E2, while the other half will be used alone vaginal prostaglandin E2.

primary_outcome.description: the length of time between the beginning of induction and the end of labor

secondary_outcome.description: uterine contractions more than 3 in 10 minutes
clinical chorioamnionitis(Maternal fever and Fetal tachycardia >160/min and Maternal tachycardia >100/min

secondary_outcome.measure: admission to neonatal intensive care unit
secondary_outcome.description: admission to neonatal intensive care unit

clinical_study.condition: Preterm Premature Rupture of Fetal Membranes
Induction of Labor Affected Fetus / Newborn

arm_group.description: 10 mg PGE2 vaginal ovul will be inserted to the posterior fornix and an 18-F Foley catheter which filling with 60 mL of saline solution will be placed into the cervix
10 mg PGE2 vaginal ovule will be inserted to the posterior fornix

intervention.description: 18-F Foley catheter which filling with 60 mL of saline solution will be placed into the cervix

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. singleton pregnancy,
2. gestational age ≥34 weeks,
3. rupture of membranes,
4. cephalic presentation,
5. bishop score ≤5,
6. had less than three uterine contractions in every 10 minutes.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients who had contraindications for vaginal delivery,
2. previous uterine surgery,
3. fetal malpresentation,
4. multifetal pregnancy,
5. more than three contractions in 10 minutes,
6. contraindications to prostaglandins,
7. a category II or III fetal heart rate pattern,
8. anomalous fetus,
9. fetal demise
10. women with immediate delivery indications -

overall_official.affiliation: Zeynep Kamil Maternity and Children's Training and Research Hospital, Department of Obstetrics and Gynecology, Istanbul, Turkey

facility.name: Zeynep Kamil Education and Research Hospital

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Zeynep Kamil Maternity and Pediatric Research and Training Hospital
